lead_paragraph: BROWN--William K.,died at peace in his sleep at the age of 81. Survived by his beloved wife of 57 years, Anita and daughter Celia Anne. Bill was a entrepreneur, innovator, public speaker, theatrical producer, actor and community leader. Bill joined Marsh & McLennan in 1969 was expert in Professional Liability Insurance. As a Managing Director he served his clients for over 30+ years. A supporter of the theatrical arts, Bill helped Anita found Montauk Theatre Productions. Later, they formed the Shooting Star Theater in NYC and were active with The Lambs. As President of The John Street Club, he energized the Club and fostered fellowship. A memorial service is planned for the fall. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BROWN, WILLIAM K.
